choices.C: Implement a single sign-on and two-factor authentication solution using a soft token.
choices.B: Add all users of the finance department to the accounting departments file server VMs access lists.
choices.A: Set up duplicate file server VMs that the finance department has access to and enable two-way replication.
choices.D: Create a new group for the finance department that will allow access to the accounting department's file server VMs.

discussion.content: I don't understand why to setup a duplicated server either. D make sense

comments.content: 2021/5/27 the question said "the finance need to access accounting's VMs", not files on the VMs.

questions.question_text:
A new service request asks for all members of the finance department to have access to the accounting department's file server VMs on the private cloud environment.
Which of the following is the MOST efficient way to fulfill this service request?

An administrator is performing a migration of a physical cluster that uses boot from SAN into private cloud. The systems administrator needs to minimize the downtime required.
Which of the following migrations is the BEST option for the systems administrator to use?

choices.B: P2V with storage migration on the hypervisor.
choices.D: P2V with raw device mapping/pass-through LUNs on the storage system.
choices.A: P2V with cold system cloning on the storage infrastructure.
choices.C: P2V with copy of the LUNs into data stores for hypervisor access.

questions.question_text:
A VM was successfully tested in a lab environment. As part of the deployment preparation, the image needs to be backed up for use in the multi-rollout accompanied by orchestration templates.
Which of the following should be used to create the image?

discussion.content: Never heard of "full" image. This scenario sure sounds like a clone. So D.

questions.question_text:
A company has a private cloud NAC solution in place to prevent unauthorized/non-company assets from connecting to the internal network. A cloud systems administrator cannot add a new physical server to the existing functioning cluster.
Which of the following is the MOST likely cause of this issue?

choices.C: The new physical server has a faulty NIC.
choices.B: The DNS and DHCP servers are down.
choices.D: Server MAC addresses are not being updated.

discussion.content: Should be D. The Mac-based NAC would be implemented for this situation and the server MAC address need to be updated in the cloud NAC solution before it be allowed to connect to the network.

The device is identified at the switch by verifying the MAC address and then granting authorization with access control lists (ACL) for the network.

Answer D.

questions.question_text:
A technician receives a call from Joe, a user, who is unable to log into any of the company's SaaS application. The applications are provided by multiple vendors.
Joe reports his credentials were working previously, and he is able to log into the locally hosted applications with the same credentials.
Which of the following is the MOST likely cause of Joe's issues?

discussion.content: If credentials work locally, how can anything be locked out or expired. Answer is A.

A. 

he's able to access the local host application but not the others. This a federation issue.

choices.D: The user's personal certificate has expired.
choices.B: The user's account is locked out.
choices.A: There is an error with the federation service.
choices.C: The user's security token has expired.
